answers.author: Michael James
answers.text:
Buncombe County, NC (Asheville area) was recently in the news for an early retirement program they initiated.  131 employees have accepted the early retirement incentive.  This has made news across the state of NC.  While I don't work for that County, I thought it may be worth sharing.  It may be worth trying to contact them.  See this article in the Asheville Citizen Times for more information.  http://www.citizen-times.com/story/news/local/2014/09/03/buncombe-county-employees-take-early-retirement/15016697/

Hi,

http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/22050/Early_Retirement_Programs

http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3932/Your_Retirement_Readiness_Assessment_in_31_Questions_An_Action_Checklist_to_Help_You_Plan_for_Your_T
You can also find a ton of information in the Retirement topic section on the Knowledge Network.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/235/Retirement
I hope this helped!
Jesse Himes, Knowledge Network Intern, jhimes@icma.org

author: [Anonymous]
text: In our municipality we have quite a few people who are close to, or already eligible for, retirement.  Our management is thinking about the possibility of offering early/retirement incentives in order to be able to put new people into place.  We have some key positions in mind and we’d like to know if other municipalities or public entities have implemented such a program and if it has been targeted or more widespread.  What was the outcome and participation level?  Our HR department has concerns about doing this with respect to perceived unfair compensation... if that was a concern for your organization, how did you overcome it?
title: Early Retirement Incentives
